intro: Gagea sivasica, commonly known as the Sivas lily, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, producing white or pale pink flowers that are often fragrant. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
